    ** Percent of people who get $40 right in the info treatment *"The correct answer could be inferred from the information on the screen: $56 for incandescents - $16 for CFLs = $40. Sixty-four percent of consumers correctly put $40. Those who did not were prompted: That is not the correct answer. Please try again. After this prompt, 73 percent of consumers had typed $40. The remaining consumers were prompted: The total costs for eight years of light are $16 for CFLs and $56 for incandescents. Therefore, the incandescents cost $40 more. You may type the number 40 into the answer box. By this point, 89 percent of consumers had correctly typed $40"
    60 [+] tab InfoTreatmentQuizFirstPrompt [aweight=Weight] // 1 = Prompt Shown, 2 = Prompt Not Shown

    • Content

      /* TESSStatementsinPaper.do */

/** This file backs up all statements in the paper about the TESS experiment and welfare calculation. 
@author Allcott and Taubinsky*/


/* STATEMENTS IN PAPER */
use Calculations/PreppedTESSData.dta, clear


** Share of consumers in EndlineOnly
tab EndlineOnly
tab EndlineOnly if T==1

** 17% of people clicked for detailed product information
gen Clicked = max(Q1_C,Q5_C)
sum Clicked [aweight=Weight]

** Non-Monotonic
sum flag_NonMonotonic1 Q1_Prompt3 [aweight=Weight]
tab flag_NonMonotonic1 Q1_Prompt3 [aweight=Weight]

sum flag_NonMonotonic2 Q5_Prompt3 [aweight=Weight]
tab flag_NonMonotonic2 Q5_Prompt3 [aweight=Weight]


** Top-coded WTPs
* WTP1
tab WTP1 [aweight=Weight]
sum StatedWTP1_Abs [aweight=Weight], detail
sum StatedWTP1 [aweight=Weight], detail, if WTP1==$WTPTopCode
sum StatedWTP1 [aweight=Weight], detail, if WTP1==-$WTPTopCode

* WTP2
sum StatedWTP2_Abs [aweight=Weight], detail
sum StatedWTP2 [aweight=Weight], detail, if WTP2==$WTPTopCode
sum StatedWTP2 [aweight=Weight], detail, if WTP2==-$WTPTopCode

****
* "Across all top-coded and bottom-coded consumers, the median absolute value of self-reported relative WTP was $15. The distribution of self-reports is skewed, with about eight percent of consumers preferring one or the other choice by more than $40."
keep ID StatedWTP? Weight
reshape long StatedWTP, i(ID) j(Dec)
gen StatedWTP_Abs = abs(StatedWTP)
sum StatedWTP_Abs [aweight=Weight], detail
****

use Calculations/PreppedTESSData.dta, clear

* Percent of treatment and control with top-coded WTP
	* "About 29 percent of treatment group endline WTPs are top-coded, as are 16 percent in the control group."
gen WTP2TopCoded = cond(WTP2==$WTPTopCode,1,0)
sum WTP2TopCoded [aweight=Weight] if T==1
sum WTP2TopCoded [aweight=Weight] if T==0


use Calculations/PreppedTESSData.dta, clear

** Percent of people who get $40 right in the info treatment  
*"The correct answer could be inferred from the information on the screen: $56 for incandescents - $16 for CFLs = $40. Sixty-four percent of consumers correctly put $40. Those who did not were prompted: That is not the correct answer. Please try again. After this prompt, 73 percent of consumers had typed $40. The remaining consumers were prompted: The total costs for eight years of light are $16 for CFLs and $56 for incandescents. Therefore, the incandescents cost $40 more. You may type the number 40 into the answer box. By this point, 89 percent of consumers had correctly typed $40"
tab InfoTreatmentQuizFirstPrompt [aweight=Weight] // 1 = Prompt Shown, 2 = Prompt Not Shown
tab InfoTreatmentQuizSecondPrompt [aweight=Weight] // 1 = Prompt Shown, 2 = Prompt Not Shown
tab InfoTreatmentQuizDollar  [aweight=Weight] // Look at the share here that put $40.


** Screen-by-screen timing
	* "Consumers spent a median of three minutes and zero seconds to complete these first 15 decisions."
sum Q1_t [aweight=Weight], detail
	* "Consumers spent a median of one minute and 20 seconds to complete these final 15 decisions"
sum Q5_t [aweight=Weight], detail

* "Consumers spent a median of two minutes and 12 seconds to read the Total Cost Information Screen and complete the quiz question."
gen InfoTreatmentSeconds = QT1_t
replace InfoTreatmentSeconds = QP1_t if QP1_t!=.
sum InfoTreatmentSeconds [aweight=Weight], detail


*** Results section
	* "average post-treatment WTP does not differ statistically between the Endline-Only group and rest of the treatment group."
use Calculations/PreppedTESSData.dta, clear
reg WTP2 EndlineOnly [pweight=Weight], robust, if T==1 

** Checking quantity effects.
	* Exactly same as calculated.
use Calculations/PreppedTESSData.dta, clear
gen PurchaseCFL = cond(WTP2>=0,1,0) if WTP2!=.
reg PurchaseCFL T [pweight=Weight], robust

gen PurchaseCFLRebate = cond(WTP2>=-1,1,0) if WTP2!=.
reg PurchaseCFLRebate T [pweight=Weight], robust



*** Beliefs
tab Q7CFLSavingsCorrect [aweight=Weight] if T==1

*** Appendix: Additional TESS results
** We cannot reject the Davis (2010) result that homeowners are 5% more likely to own CFLs.
gen PurchaseCFL1_0 = cond(WTP1>0,1,0)
reg PurchaseCFL1_0 OwnHome [pweight=Weight], robust
reg PurchaseCFL1_0 $DemographicVars [pweight=Weight], robust


** Descriptive statistics on beta, delta
sum beta [aweight=Weight], detail
sum delta [aweight=Weight], detail


*** Welfare analysis
** Winsorized average WTP for bottom-coded group at baseline
sum WTP1_top4 [aweight=Weight] if WTP1==-15
*sum WTP1_top3 [aweight=Weight] if WTP1==-15

      • Tokens

        TESSStatementsinPaper   TESSStatementsinPaper do
